# Overview and Scope of the Political/Economic Discussion Board

## Introduction
This document provides an in-depth overview, defines the scope, and captures the foundational goals and concepts behind the Political/Economic Discussion Board project. Designed as a central reference for all stakeholders—especially non-developers—it articulates the project's aspirations, boundaries, and success metrics. Clearly defined user roles (member, moderator, admin) guide feature and permissions planning throughout.

## Purpose & Business Goals
The central purpose of this platform is to foster informed, respectful dialogue around political and economic topics. The project aims to:  
- **Encourage community participation**: Enable users from diverse backgrounds to engage in meaningful discussions that bridge social and ideological divides.
- **Support knowledge sharing**: Provide an accessible space for exchanging viewpoints, data, and analyses on current political and economic issues.
- **Cultivate civil discourse**: Create mechanisms for respectful debate, reducing misinformation and toxic behavior through strong moderation and reporting.
- **Drive platform growth & engagement**: Implement features (likes, comments, post creation, reporting) that increase daily active users, session duration, and content generation.
- **Support platform scalability and stability**: Design for expansion, anticipating increased user volume and topic diversity as popularity grows.
- **Establish brand authority**: Position the project as a go-to source for balanced, intelligent discussions in the targeted domain.

Key business goals include:
- Achieve a monthly active user base of 10,000 within the first year
- Maintain user report resolution rates above 95% within 24 hours
- Reach a user-generated content count (posts & comments) that grows by at least 15% month-over-month

## Scope of the Project

The scope encompasses features that:
- Enable user registration, authentication, and profile management
- Allow members to create, edit, comment on, like, and report posts in political and economic categories
- Empower moderators with moderation tools (editing, hiding, deleting, and flagging content, managing reports)
- Provide admins with comprehensive management tools for all users, roles, and system configurations
- Ensure robust permission handling, API authentication, and security
- Present a modern, intuitive UI for desktop and mobile users
- Integrate analytics to monitor platform use, flag abuse, and inform future feature planning

The platform intentionally excludes real-time chat features, external advertising modules, or direct financial transactions in its initial phase.

For detailed functional requirements, refer to [02_discussionboard_functional_requirements.md](./02_discussionboard_functional_requirements.md).

## Target Audience & Stakeholders

The discussion board serves a broad and diverse audience:
- **General Members**: Users interested in political and economic news, analysis, and conversation; includes students, professionals, and the general public.
- **Content Contributors**: Subject-matter experts, bloggers, commentators, or news aggregators seeking a platform for outreach
- **Moderators**: Community members trusted to uphold guidelines and foster respectful exchange; typically active, experienced participants
- **Administrators**: Technical and content managers responsible for platform supervision, growth strategies, and user management

Additional stakeholders include:
- **Partner organizations**: Universities, think tanks, or nonprofits seeking dialogue opportunities or knowledge sharing
- **Platform Developers/Operations**: Technical staff implementing and maintaining the system
- **Advertisers & Sponsors** (future phase): Entities interested in reaching an engaged, informed audience (currently outside scope)

## Key Concepts and Definitions
- **Member**: Authenticated user participating in posts, comments, likes, and reports; includes all community members by default
- **Moderator**: Elevated user role with capability to enforce rules, manage content/reporting, and intervene in discussions when necessary
- **Admin**: Ultimate system authority, controls user management, system configuration, and overall platform health

See permissions breakdown in [03_discussionboard_user_roles_and_permissions.md](./03_discussionboard_user_roles_and_permissions.md).

## Out of Scope
Certain advanced features are explicitly excluded:
- Real-time voice/video chat
- External ad serving or in-platform e-commerce
- Integration with external single sign-on providers (SSO)

## Success Criteria
Success of the discussion board will be measured by both qualitative and quantitative indicators:
- **Quantitative KPIs:**
    - Monthly active users surpass 10,000
    - User retention rate exceeds 60% after three months
    - Content growth (posts, comments) increases at least 15% per month
    - 95% of user reports resolved by moderators/admins within 24 hours
- **Qualitative Metrics:**
    - Positive community feedback (survey, net promoter score, review analysis)
    - Notable recognition or partnership initiation with reputable organizations
    - Platform cited as a reference or resource within political and economic discussions online
- **Platform Reliability:**
    - Achieve 99.5% or greater uptime across all core features
    - Minimal downtime or critical incidents impacting user experience

These criteria will be continually reviewed and updated as the platform evolves.

- [Functional Requirements](./02_discussionboard_functional_requirements.md)
- [User Roles & Permissions](./03_discussionboard_user_roles_and_permissions.md)

# Discussion Board Functional Requirements

## 1. Introduction
This document outlines the functional requirements for the Discussion Board platform, serving as guidance for system developers and stakeholders. It incorporates role-specific actions aligned with business goals, ensuring the platform supports robust user engagement and effective moderation.

## 2. User Roles Covered
- **Member**: Standard users who create and interact with content, and report inappropriate material.
- **Moderator**: Trusted users with tools for content oversight and rule enforcement.
- **Admin**: Platform managers with full system access and user administration capabilities.

(For a breakdown of permissions, see [03_discussionboard_user_roles_and_permissions.md](./03_discussionboard_user_roles_and_permissions.md))

## 3. Core Functional Requirements

### 3.1. User Registration & Authentication
- Users must be able to register new accounts and log in securely.
- Support password reset and account recovery workflows.
- Implement role-based authentication reflecting member, moderator, and admin distinctions.

### 3.2. Creating & Managing Posts
- Authenticated members can create, edit, and delete their own posts.
- Posts must support categorization: at minimum, "Politics" and "Economics" boards.
- Enable formatting (basic Markdown or WYSIWYG), tagging, and optional attachments (e.g., images).
- Display post timestamps and author information.

### 3.3. Commenting Functionality
- Users can comment on posts within both discussion categories.
- Support threaded (nested) comments for clear conversation flow.
- Enable editing and deletion of own comments.
- Comment timestamps and author info are shown.

### 3.4. User Interactions (Likes & Reporting)
- Registered users can like posts and comments (1 like per user per item).
- Users may report posts/comments for abuse, spam, or other guideline violations.
- Capture reporting reasons and support multiple report types.
- Block double-reporting on identical content from the same user.

### 3.5. Moderation Tools
- Moderators access a dashboard displaying recent reports and flagged items.
- Permit moderators to delete or hide posts/comments following review.
- Enable warning issuing, user muting, or temporary bans.
- Provide moderators with review status tracking for reported content.

### 3.6. Administration
- Admins can manage user accounts (activate, deactivate, assign/revoke roles).
- Enable admin access to content analytics for audit and improvement.
- Platform-wide settings (e.g., discussion board categories, moderation policies) are configurable by admins only.

### 3.7. Notifications
- Users receive in-app notifications for activity on their posts/comments (e.g., replies, likes, moderator actions).
- Customizable notification preferences per user.

### 3.8. Search & Discovery
- Search functionality across posts and comments (by keyword, author, tags).
- Filter posts by category, recency, popularity, or unresolved reports.

### 3.9. Access & Security
- All sensitive operations must enforce role-appropriate authentication.
- Implement input validation and anti-spam protection.
- All actions should be logged for auditability by admins.

---
For additional details and rationale behind these features, see [01_discussionboard_overview_and_scope.md](./01_discussionboard_overview_and_scope.md).

# User Roles & Permissions for the Discussion Board

## Overview
Proper role-based access control is essential for the operation, management, and security of the discussion board. This document outlines all user roles, their permissions, and summarizes core mechanisms for authentication and authorization. This model supports maintainability, secure access, and future feature growth.

## Defined User Roles

| Role       | Description                                                                                                       |
|------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Member     | Regular registered user who can participate in discussions, create and interact with posts, and use reporting features. |
| Moderator  | Trusted user responsible for content oversight, enforcing guidelines, and handling reported items.               |
| Admin      | System administrator with comprehensive platform control, including user, moderator, and settings management.     |

## Permissions Matrix

| Permission                              | Member | Moderator | Admin |
|------------------------------------------|:------:|:---------:|:-----:|
| Register / Login                        |   ✓    |     ✓     |   ✓   |
| Create, Edit, Delete Own Posts          |   ✓    |     ✓     |   ✓   |
| Comment / Like                          |   ✓    |     ✓     |   ✓   |
| Report Inappropriate Content            |   ✓    |     ✓     |   ✓   |
| Moderate (Edit/Delete Others’ Content)  |        |     ✓     |   ✓   |
| Manage Reports/Resolve Issues           |        |     ✓     |   ✓   |
| Manage Members (ban, role change)       |        |           |   ✓   |
| Manage Moderators                       |        |           |   ✓   |
| Access Admin Dashboard/Settings         |        |           |   ✓   |
| Platform Configuration                  |        |           |   ✓   |

## Role Change & Escalation
- **Promotion to Moderator**: Only Admin can assign Moderator roles.
- **Demotion/Promotion**: Admin can manage all role assignments. Members and Moderators cannot self-promote.
- **Ban/Deactivate**: Admin can suspend or ban any user; Moderators may suggest bans (for Admin review).

## Authentication & Authorization Model
- **Authentication**: All users (member, moderator, admin) authenticate via secure login (email/password or SSO).
- **Session Management**: Tokens/session cookies to represent active logins; refresh as required.
- **Authorization**: Role is bundled with user profile; each API checks role-linked permissions prior to fulfilling requests.
- **API Enforcement**: Endpoints are protected so only users with sufficient permissions can execute sensitive actions (e.g., moderation, admin commands).

## User Management Flows
- **User Registration & Login**: Members self-register; moderators/admins are promoted by Admin.
- **Role Assignment/Revoke**: Only Admin has API/UI controls to configure roles for any user.
- **Audit Logging**: Sensitive actions, especially bans or role changes, are logged for traceability.

## Security & Best Practices
- All privileged actions (moderator/admin) require authentication and strong authorization checks.
- Minimize privilege escalation risk by preventing self-assignment of higher roles.
- Regularly audit user role changes; provide notification of changes to affected users.

## Appendix
- For business rules and API endpoint protection: see [02_discussionboard_functional_requirements.md].
- For the platform’s overall scope: see [01_discussionboard_overview_and_scope.md].
